title: Apex to open new satellite factory in Los Angeles
summary: Satellite manufacturer Apex will open a new factory next year to ramp up production of small satellites.

title: Daily Telescope: How small can the smallest star be?
summary: So tiny you can barely see it.

title: Amazon seeks dismissal of Project Kuiper launch contract lawsuit
summary: Amazon is seeking to dismiss a shareholder lawsuit filed in August that alleged that the company’s board of directors acted in bad faith when it awarded Project Kuiper launch contracts to Arianespace, Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance.

title: Senators question White House mission authorization proposal
summary: As officials from several federal agencies expressed support for a White House proposal for oversight of novel space activities, the chair of a key Senate subcommittee raised concerns about it.

title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Completes Aerospike Engine Test Campaign
summary:
German startup POLARIS Spaceplanes has completed the test campaign of its 1kN AS-1B linear aerospike engine, a version of which will power its MIRA demonstrator. MIRA is a 4,25-metre-long demonstration vehicle that is equipped with four kerosene-fed turbine engines and one of the company’s LOX/kerosene linear aerospike engines. Testing under the power of its four […]
The post POLARIS Spaceplanes Completes Aerospike Engine Test Campaign appeared first on European Spaceflight.
